str2: Then, thereafter, afterwards. From epi and eita; thereafter.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To live, be alive. A primary verb; to live.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To leave behind; pass: To be left behind, remain, survive. From peri and leipo; to leave all around, i.e. survive.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Passive - 1st Person Plural
str2: To seize, snatch, obtain by robbery. From a derivative of haireomai; to seize.
A primary particle; properly, at the 'same' time, but freely used as a preposition or adverb denoting close association.
With. A primary preposition denoting union; with or together.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
A cloud. From nephos; properly, cloudiness, i.e. a cloud.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
From apantao; a encounter.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Air, the lower air we breathe. From aemi; 'air'.
And, even, also, namely.
Thus, so, in this manner. Or (referring to what precedes or follows).

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 1st Person Plural
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Always, at all times, ever. From pas and hote; every when, i.e. At all times.
With. A primary preposition denoting union; with or together.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
